funFacts.label: Peak seasons
funFacts.detail: Q1 (77 PRs) + Q4 (71 PRs) = 148 PRs. You turned the start and finish of 2025 into full-on shipping marathons.

funFacts.label: Biggest single PR
funFacts.detail: ) weighed in at +89,325/-2,438. That's not a PR — it's a feature expansion pack.

funFacts.label: Review powerhouse
funFacts.detail: You gave 273 reviews — with @cloudinary-pkoniu (47) and @netaeiny (40) as your top teammates supported. Human CI, activated.

funFacts.label: Permissions era
funFacts.detail: A recurring theme: permission_enforce work across cloudinary (e.g., Folder Search, Move/Rename, Restore actions). Security and UX, both leveled up.

funFacts.label: Release-captain energy
funFacts.detail: Major release trains rolled through dl_object_detection (e.g., PR #4473 at +93,196/-70,015). You helped shepherd the big merges safely home.

bigRocks.title: Async Awakening: Capsule-Powered Media Analyzer
bigRocks.impact: Introduced true async analysis flows via Capsule AsyncSend, unlocking scalable AI Vision + Captioning without blocking worker lifecycles.

bigRocks.title: S3-Backed Async Responses (a.k.a.
bigRocks.impact: Moved async responses onto S3 and tightened the pipeline so results can be fetched reliably under real-world load.

bigRocks.title: Captain Crash, Meet GPT: Incident Summaries That Actually Help
bigRocks.impact: Built out the Captain GPT capability and improved incident context so teams get clearer, more actionable crash summaries in Slack.

bigRocks.title: Asset-ID Era for the API
bigRocks.impact: Expanded resource endpoints to support asset_id/public_id operations, improving parity and flexibility for integrations.

bigRocks.title: Release Train Conductor: Massive RC Merge
bigRocks.impact: Drove one of the year's biggest rollups, keeping the service moving while changes landed at scale.

quarterlyActivity.highlights: Launched the year with Media Analyzer expansions (Watermark/IQA) and a flurry of Captain Crash foundations — early momentum set the tone.
Permissions + platform polish in cloudinary, plus steady ops improvements — the
Fewer PRs, bigger punches: groundwork for async + reliability tweaks, and tight customer-facing fixes (no pixelz error leaks).
The finishing sprint: Capsule async mega-PR, S3 async responses, infra tuning, and dl_object_detection release work — closing 2025 at full throttle.

topRepos.name: cloudinary
topRepos.funFact: tour guide — from Folder Search enforcement to asset move/rename flows and RESTORE actions.

topRepos.name: media_analyzer
topRepos.funFact: Home of the year's largest leap: async analysis via Capsule, plus billing bypass and S3-based response delivery.

topRepos.name: captain-crash-lambda
topRepos.funFact: The on-call sidekick got superpowers: GPT summaries, richer context providers, and Slack UX upgrades.

topRepos.name: dl_object_detection
topRepos.funFact: Where release engineering meets reliability — e2e hardening, deployment flow fixes, and huge RC merges.

topRepos.name: mms-infra
topRepos.funFact: Quiet but crucial: capacity tuning, scaling rule experiments, and container dependency order for graceful shutdowns.

yearInReview.headline: The Year of Async & Reliability
yearInReview.tagline: 212 PRs merged • 239,563 lines added • 273 reviews • 5 repos • from permissions hardening to Capsule-powered async at massive scale
